resources.string: Can\'t find any game maps in MinecraftPE\'s external maps folder. Have you set MinecraftPE to use external storage?

To let MinecraftPE use external storage, open it, click \"Settings\" from it\'s home screen, select \"Profile\" on the left panel, then scroll down the right pane and chang \"File Storage Location\" to \"External\".
MinecraftPE\'s gamemap folder can\'t be found. Have you really installed MinecraftPE from Play Store or Amazon?
It seems that Convarter was not permitted to read or write external storage. In order to use, please go to Settings or phone management apps to allow Convarter to use permission \"Storage\".
You haven\'t imported any scripts yet~ Click the \"Add\" button to add one~
Convarter can directly detect any scripts under /sdcard/%1$s. Just place scripts there, then you won\'t need to import.

By selecting "Copy", the chosen script will be copied to Convarter's library, then any loss or damage to the orginal file won't influence the copied script.

By selecting "Link", Convarter will only remember where the script is, and read it out right before every time you use it. In this way, you don't have to re-import it after editing it.

Well just click "Copy" if you didn't get it...
By clicking \"Copy\", the selected script will be copied to Convarter\'s library. By clicking \"Link\" it would be linked to.
Failed: scripts directory can\'t be created.
Well you don\'t need to import it :(
Script output will be shown here.\n
Error: can\'t load database /db from selected gamemap.
Error: can\'t open level.dat of the gamemap.
Error: Progress can\'t be saved to /db.

A \"Chunk\" in Minecraft is a certain region of gamemap containing all blocks within, both width and length (x and z directions) are 16, and height varies between 16~256 depending how tall you build. They are stored in your device\'s storage. Some of them can be temporarily stored in memory to accelerate read and write operations. We can store an amount of chunks up to the limit you set above. If the number is too much the app will crash, if it\'s too little the process will be very slow. Usually you should leave the default value unchanged.
Don\'t show advanced options of javascript
This will create an empty flat game map in creative mode. You can then modify flat layers.
Override existing areas (won\'t break your buildings)
"Click to edit. Drag block icon to sort, "
There should be at least three layers.
Amount of all blocks should be 0~128, make sure it won\'t exceed the limit.
Amount of block should be larger than 0.
It\'s easy to use, just as shown above.
This is not a flat world, layers are not loaded. Editing this type of game map may leave huge holes as we won\'t generate terrian.
This is a flat world but we failed loading flat layers.
This is not a flat map at all.
Generate flat layers for new chunks

Hello~ This app is still an experimental one, and may not work on game maps that are too old or too new, Please backup your game maps before using! And we may add features such as 3D visual editing in the future, well who knows~ Meow~ Because of Minecraft itself\'s problem, editing superflat only takes effect in case you fully quit the game before using this feature. And...Well,javascript feature crashes randomly, so close your eyes and pray.

Though all your modifications to existing areas (placing, replacing or breaking) won\'t be overridden, in case you add more layers, they may get buried under new layers. If you add sands they may fall and destroy blocks beneath. And if you reduced layers, flowers and circuits above may not survive. So think twice and have your map backed up before running this app!!!
Your map is for Minecraft version below 1.2. Opening it with newer Minecraft would reset layers to default. You can then however, run this feature again.
